Package ohos.miscservices.timeutility

Class Timer.OneShotTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.miscservices.timeutility.Timer.OneShotTimer
  • Enclosing class:
    Timer

    public static class Timer.OneShotTimer
extends Object
    Provides the oneshot timer function.

    There are two types of oneshot timers. The difference lies in the action after a oneshot timer goes off. The system sends an Intent object to an application, or invokes the ITimerListener callback.

    Since:
    1

    • Method Detail

      • getTimer

        public static Timer.OneShotTimer getTimer​(Context context,
                                          Timer.TimerIntent operation)
        Obtains a oneshot timer object.

        When the timer goes off, the system sends an intent to start a component.

        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the application context.
        operation - Indicates the intent to send when the timer goes off.
        Returns:
        Returns the OneShotTimer instance that is created using the operation as the key.
        Since:
        1

      • getTimer

        public static Timer.OneShotTimer getTimer​(Context context,
                                          Timer.ITimerListener listener)
        Obtains a oneshot timer.

        When the timer goes off, the system calls the ITimerListener interface.

        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the application context.
        listener - Indicates a listener to monitor whether the timer goes off.
        Returns:
        Returns a OneShotTimer instance monitored by the listener.
        Since:
        1

      • start

        public void start​(int type,
                  long triggerTime)
        Starts a timer.
        Parameters:
        type - Indicates a timer type.
        triggerTime - Indicates the point in time for triggering the timer, in milliseconds. The time will be automatically set to 5000 milliseconds after the current time if the passed value is smaller than the current time plus 5000 milliseconds.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        Timer.TIMER_TYPE_REALTIME, Timer.TIMER_TYPE_WAKEUP, Timer.TIMER_TYPE_EXACT

      • stop

        public void stop​()
        Cancels the timer.

        The timer to be canceled is related to the second parameter of the following methods:

        • OneShotTimer#getTimer(Context, TimerIntent)
        • OneShotTimer#getTimer(Context, ITimerListener)

        Note: If a timer is created based on Intent, calling this method will cancel all timers. If a timer is created based on a listener defined by ITimerListener, calling this method will cancel all timers monitored by the listener.

        Since:
        1
